title: Sally Lunn
ingredients: ½ cup (1 stick) softened butter or margarine
3 eggs, bell beaten, at room temperature
instructions: Measure the warm water into a large warm bowl.  Sprinkle in the yeast and stir until its dissolved.  Add the milk, the butter (or margarine), sugar, salt, and eggs.  Stir in 3 cups of flour and with an electric beater, beat until the ingredients are well blended, about 1 minute.  Stir in enough of the remaining flour to make a soft dough.  Cover, and let rise in a warm place, free from air drafts, until its doubled in bulk, about one hour.
Stir down and spoon into a well greased and floured 10-inch bunt pan.  Again cover and let rise in a warm place, free from air drafts, until again doubled in bulk, about 1 hour.
Bake at 400° F. about 30 minutes, or until done.  Let pan cool for five minutes then remove from the pan and cool on a wire rack.
